content: Combat sport events in 2022 ***ONE 157: Petchmorakot vs. Vienot*** was a [combat sport](/wiki/Combat_sport) event produced by [ONE Championship](/wiki/ONE_Championship) that took place on May 20, 2022, at the [Singapore Indoor Stadium](/wiki/Singapore_Indoor_Stadium) in [Kallang](/wiki/Kallang), Singapore. ## Background A [ONE Featherweight Muay Thai World Championship](/wiki/List_of_ONE_Championship_champions#Featherweight_Championship_3) bout between current champion [Petchmorakot Petchyindee](/wiki/Petchmorakot_Petchyindee_Academy) and [Jimmy Vienot](/wiki/Jimmy_Vienot) headlined the event. A [ONE Strawweight Muay Thai World Championship](/wiki/List_of_ONE_Championship_champions#Strawweight_World_Championship) bout between the champion [Prajanchai P.K.Saenchai](/wiki/Prajanchai_P.K.Saenchaimuaythaigym) and title challenger [Joseph Lasiri](/wiki/Joseph_Lasiri) was expected to take place at ONE: Lights Out but it was postponed due to Lasiri getting injury during his training camp. They met at this event instead scheduled as the co-main event. The quarterfinal bouts of the [ONE Flyweight Muay Thai World Grand Prix Tournament](/wiki/2022_in_ONE_Championship#ONE_Muay_Thai_Flyweight_Grand_Prix_bracket) will be held during the event. A ONE Flyweight Muay Thai Grand Prix bout between current ONE Flyweight Muay Thai Champion [Rodtang Jitmuangnon](/wiki/Rodtang_Jitmuangnon) and Jacob Smith was expected to take place at [ONE on TNT 1](/wiki/2021_in_ONE_Championship#ONE_on_TNT_1) in last April, but Smith withdraw from the bout due to injury. The pairing was rebooked for this event. Two lightweight submission grappling matches were announced for the event: between former Featherweight title Challenger [Garry Tonon](/wiki/Garry_Tonon) and [Tye Ruotolo](/wiki/Tye_Ruotolo), as well as between Former 2-time [ONE Lightweight Champions](/wiki/List_of_ONE_Championship_champions#Lightweight_World_Championship) [Shinya Aoki](/wiki/Shinya_Aoki) and Kade Ruotolo. A Heavyweight Kickboxing bout, [Rade Opačić](/wiki/Rade_Opa%C4%8Di%C4%87) and [Guto Inocente](/wiki/Guto_Inocente) was scheduled for the event. However, the bout was pushed back to [ONE 158](/wiki/ONE_158) for Inocente tested positive for [COVID-19](/wiki/COVID-19). A heavyweight bout between [Marcus Almeida](/wiki/Marcus_Almeida) and [Oumar Kane](/wiki/Oumar_Kane) was scheduled for [ONE 156](/wiki/ONE_156). However, the bout was moved to this event due to Oumar Kane injury and was replaced by Hugo Cunha. However, Cunha tested positive for COVID-19 before the event and was replaced by Jasur Mirzamukhamedov. However, Mirzamukhamedov tested positive for COVID-19 After traveling to Singapore. the bout will be rescheduled for Buchecha and expected to return to action at [ONE 158](/wiki/ONE_158). A Women's Atomweight bout between [Alyse Anderson](/wiki/Alyse_Anderson) and Asha Roka was scheduled for [ONE X](/wiki/ONE_X). However, Anderson withdraw from the bout for medical reasons. The pairing was rebooked for this event. [Jonathan Haggerty](/wiki/Jonathan_Haggerty) was set to face [Walter Goncalves](/wiki/Walter_Goncalves) in the quarter-finals of the [ONE Flyweight Muay Thai World Grand Prix](/wiki/2022_in_ONE_Championship#ONE_Muay_Thai_Flyweight_Grand_Prix_bracket). However, Haggerty was forced to pull out of his bout at the last minute due to health issue and was replaced by Josue Cruz, who had been set to compete in a Grand Prix alternate bout against [Panpayak Jitmuangnon](/wiki/Panpayak_Jitmuangnon) earlier in the card. ## Results Main Card (YouTube / Watch ONE)Weight classMethodRoundTimeNotesFeatherweight Muay Thai[Petchmorakot Petchyindee](/wiki/Petchmorakot_Petchyindee_Academy) (c)def.[Jimmy Vienot](/wiki/Jimmy_Vienot)Decision (split)53:00[a]Strawweight Muay Thai[Joseph Lasiri](/wiki/Joseph_Lasiri)def.[Prajanchai P.K.Saenchai](/wiki/Prajanchai_P.K.Saenchaimuaythaigym) (c)TKO (retirement)33:00[b]Flyweight Muay Thai[Rodtang Jitmuangnon](/wiki/Rodtang_Jitmuangnon)def.Jacob SmithDecision (unanimous)33:00[c]Lightweight Submission Grappling[Tye Ruotolo](/wiki/Tye_Ruotolo)def.[Garry Tonon](/wiki/Garry_Tonon)Submission (D'Arce choke)11:27Lightweight Submission Grappling[Kade Ruotolo](/wiki/Kade_Ruotolo)def.[Shinya Aoki](/wiki/Shinya_Aoki)Decision (unanimous)110:00Flyweight Muay Thai[Walter Goncalves](/wiki/Walter_Goncalves)def.Josue CruzTKO (knees)10:35[d]Lead Card (YouTube / Watch ONE)Flyweight Muay Thai[Superlek Kiatmoo9](/wiki/Superlek_Kiatmuu9)def.[Taiki Naito](/wiki/Taiki_Naito)Decision (unanimous)33:00[e]Flyweight Muay Thai[Savvas Michael](/wiki/Savvas_Michael)def.Amir NaseriDecision (unanimous)33:00[f]Women's Atomweight[Alyse Anderson](/wiki/Alyse_Anderson)def.Asha RokaSubmission (triangle choke)12:04Featherweight Kickboxing[Mohammed Boutasaa](/wiki/Mohammed_Boutasaa)def.[Davit Kiria](/wiki/Davit_Kiria)Decision (unanimous)33:00Women's StrawweightNat Jaroonsakdef.Zeba BanoSubmission (armbar)11:22Flyweight Muay ThaiSherzod Kabutovdef.Denis PurićDecision (unanimous)33:00[g]StrawweightElipitua Siregardef.Robin CatalanSubmission (anaconda choke)12:58 ## Bonus awards The following fighters received $50,000 bonuses. -
